bill_title: authorize the designation of Purple Star schools.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to authorize the designation of Purple Star schools. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added: 13-53E-3. Purple Star school--Designation--Rules. The secretary of education may designate a school as a Purple Star school if: (1) The school designates a staff member to serve as a military liaison and directs the liaison to: (a) Identify military-connected students enrolled in the school; and (b) Serve as a point of contact between the school, community-based support services, and military-connected students and their families; (2) The school provides on its website: (a) The contact information for the military liaison; (b) Information regarding relocation, enrollment, and record transfers between schools for military-connected students; (c) Information regarding academic planning for military-connected students, including course sequences and the availability of advanced placement courses; (d) Information regarding counseling, mentoring, volunteering, support services, and other programs for military-connected students; and (e) Information regarding the interstate compact on educational opportunity for military children, as set forth in chapter 13-53E; (3) The school implements, with the assistance of other students, a program to assist military-connected students in transitioning to the school; (4) The school provides staff development opportunities related to issues and challenges faced by military-connected students; and (5) The school: (a) Recognizes and celebrates the month of the military child; or (b) Provides opportunities for military personnel, including veterans, to volunteer at the school, speak at an assembly, provide virtual presentations, or host a field trip. The department of education shall promulgate rules, in accordance with chapter 1-26, to establish the manner in which a school may apply for designation as a purple star school and establish the process, including the statewide rubric, by which the application is to be reviewed and eligibility for the designation determined. For purposes of this section, a military-connected student is a student who is enrolled in an elementary or high school or receiving early childhood services from a school or school district, and either has or had a parent on active duty, on reserve duty, or in the National Guard.
